about.main: netizen.org propels curious citizens of the ‘net beyond problematic defaults towards a more creative, playful, and equitable digital world. We are a collective of new media artists, educators, and activists on a mission to reestablish human agency in the information age through public lectures, workshops, digital tools, online events, and festivals.
about.sub: We're a 501(c)(3) organization co-run by the folks in the image below, SHAWNÉ MICHAELAIN HOLLOWAY, Nick Briz and jon.satrom with support from many others. You can contact us at hi@netizen.org.

initiatives.main: At netizen.org, our goal is to transform “users” into “netizens” who are critically engaged with the digital technologies that make up our networked environment. While the projects featured here vary in their format, from interactive online platforms to participatory in-person events, they all share a commitment to this central mission: empowering individuals to understand, question, and creatively shape the digital world.
initiatives.sub: The term "netizen" or "Internet citizen" was coined in the 90s when the Internet, thanks in large part to the Web, started to go mainstream. Netizen's were those who didn't just use the net, but took an active role in creating it; stewarding the digital commons and protecting it's core values of open access, net neutrality, privacy and free speech.
